result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy R Ainsworth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-Undergo any assessments and counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
-Continue to comply with counseling at ministry behavioral health.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
-Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
-Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
-Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  
-No contact with A.L.J. unless approved by the agent. 
-Do not be on the premises of Walmart during pendency of probation.
-Submit DNA Sample.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

miscConds.notes: Comply with conditions as set forth in Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy R Ainsworth

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

11:12 AM Defendant Jeremy R Ainsworth in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Jeremy R Ainsworth. 
Cases heard at this time are 21CF-370 and 22CF-33. 

Court calls cases.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
22CF-33 Count 1 and Count 2 Defendant will plead to. Count 3 will be dismissed and read in.
21CF-370: Dismissed outright.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present, but did submit an impact statement.
Atty Bergner did receive a copy of the statement and has shared with his client for which he read.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CF-33: Count 1: No Contest.
22CF-33: Count 2: No Contest.

Atty Pfeil states the joint recommendation. Restitution is paid in full.
Atty Bergner addresses the Court.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Defense stipulates that Defendant qualifies for repeater status.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty of 22CF33 Count 1 and Count 2, contrary to the statute section stated therein.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of convictions this date.
22CF-33: Count 3: Dismissed and read in.
21CF-370: Dismissed outright.

Court confirms that restitution has been paid to both victims.

Atty Pfeil makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Bergner makes sentencing arguments to the court, this is a joint recommendation.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
22CF-33:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for a period of 15 months.
Conditions:
Undergo any assessments and counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
Continue to comply with counseling at ministry behavioral health.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
No contact with A.L.J. unless approved by the agent. 
Do not be on the premises of Walmart during pendency of probation.
Pay costs and surcharges.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Submit DNA Sample. 


Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for a period of 15 months.
Concurrent to Count 1.
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as set forth in Count 1.
Pay costs and surcharges.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Submit DNA Sample.
A.H. victim impact statement filed by the State
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
matter scheduled for plea/sent 7/8/22 at 10:30
Defendant Record Update
matter scheduled for ptc 4/25/22 at 9:30
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Prosecutor.
Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Waiver of Preliminary Examination filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:21 PM Defendant Jeremy R Ainsworth appeared in court, Attorney Maxwell Bergner for Jeremy R Ainsworth appeared in court, Attorney Brian J Pfeil for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
No contact with the Plover Walmart or A.L.J.

02:20 PM Defendant Jeremy R Ainsworth in court with Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court questions if the defendant objects to him residing over the initial appearance today. 
Defendant does not object. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney does not waive time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

State recommends a signature bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Bergner does not object.  The defendant will need to know the name of the victim.
Atty Cassidy provides the name.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Victim Impact Statement filed by the State
filed by the State
